title: Translating the limit
text: Based on the precise definition of a limit, then if we use the information from the limit we get If $$0<|x-3|<\delta$$, then $$|f{\left(x\right)}-2|<\epsilon$$.

title: Using the precise definition of a limit
text: The precise definition of a limit tells us that if $$x$$ is closer than delta to $$3$$ and $$x$$ is not equal to $$3$$, then f(x) is closer to than epsilon to $$2$$.

title: Visualizing
text: In essence, we are asked to find how close to $$3$$ must $$x$$ be, if $$y$$ is within epsilon unit of $$2$$ on the graph. We can find this by drawing boundary lines on the graph that fulfill these conditions and making delta the distance from $$x=3$$ to the closer of the $$2$$ $$x-boundary$$ lines.
